english: Ji River (ancient); to aid; to relieve; to ferry across

etymology.description: semantic: 水 (water) + phonetic: 齊 (simplified as 齐).
etymology.interpretation: Water as the semantic element ties the graph to crossing rivers, relief, and helping. The phonetic 齊 contributes the approximate sound, while the semantics point to actions involving water and aid.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the phonetic 齊 with its simplified form 齐, while keeping the water element; this reduces strokes and yields 济.

examples.chinese: 我们接济了他(我們接濟了他)。
政府提供救济(政府提供救濟)。
古代的济水在今河南(古代的濟水在今河南)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài de Jìshuǐ zài jīn Hénán.
examples.english: The ancient Ji River was in present-day Henan.
